intro: Cocculus smilacinus, commonly known as the scarlet bower vine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and striking red flowers. The plant produces small, green berries that turn yellow when mature, often containing a single seed. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped with a smooth texture, and it thrives in warm, humid climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain areas.
